channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged paving, 19th June
item.description:
Resident had three falls in the past two years where the paving slabs are uneven first fall was on Oakwood drive which has been fixed she fell again Hillingdon Road, all the pavements in that area are broken, Manor Way, Westfield, up to Mayplace road near letter box everywhere the pavements are raised –On Eastleigh Road a child fell and smashed their face up, all the pavements around this need attention because they are raised in places and very dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillingdon Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Traffice lights causing MAJOR conjestion on A2, 19th June
item.description:
Contractors working for Thames water have installed temporary traffic lights junction A2 and Westmount road. This has caused tail backs to Falconwood (1+ mile) and congestion on local roads. Please get these things removed!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmount Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Feeding of birds, 19th June
item.description:
This is not an acceptable way to dispose of unwanted bread . Bad for birds, attracts vermin and is unsightly

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Walford Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Broken slabs o/s 1A Westmoreland Avenue, 19th June
item.description:
Broken slabs o/s 1A Westmoreland Avenue - green paint was put down there a few weeks as if it was going to get fixed...contractors turned up this morning and have done work o/s no.1 but not o/s their property that they feel is in worse condition and the paving moves if walked on and resident worried could cause an accident...
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Avenue, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned roadworks, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Hillview Drive Street Sign flat on the ground and hidden, 19th June
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Excessive weeds on pavement and kerbside, 19th June
item.description:
There are excessive, overgrown weeds on the pavements and kerbsides around the junction of Hythe Avenue and into Stapleton road and nearby roads. These are not only unsightly but can cause an obstruction to pedestrians and when entering and exiting parked cars. The council used to remove these periodically but haven’t done so for a very long time (years?). Please can these weeds be removed periodically. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stapleton Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect placement of 3 whites lines in parking zone c, 19th June
item.description:
I agree wirh my neighbour as below...please attend to this ASAP⬇️ Outside ark school Amberley road Before bike storage you have zone c parking interrupted by ⚠️3 white lines adjacent to another zone c parking.⚠️ This is incorrect and confusing to resident. Please remove these incorrectly placed white lines and penalties should not be issued in this specific case.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Amberley Road, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a a few spots up and down Dursley Road where furniture and lots of other abbondoned rubbish at different spots up and down Dursley Road, 19th June
item.description:
There is a pile of dumped rubbish at the midpoint of the road that is a major eyesore and there is numerous bits of furniture (sofa, chairs, household furniture/items) at many other points up and down the street. It has been building over the past few weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dursley Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect white lines within zone c bays, 19th June
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping, 19th June
item.description:
We have a consistent problem of people dumping their rubbish on top & around our residential bins located to the side of our building. They throw everything— boxes, bin bags, large items. We would really appreciate a real solution from Council. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clarissa Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed hum is loose, 19th June
item.description:
The speed hump is getting loose and coming apart. Secondly the speed humps are not as effective and the council should consider putting one across the road totally as cars are constantly speeding down here and never keeping to 20mph.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Merbury Road, London
